page.title: 10RYTON ON DUNSMORE
page.content: The village predates the Domesday Survey in which it is referred to as {"RIETON",}or Rye Farm. It is situated 12 Km SE from the centre of Coventry. { The village is cut in two by the A45. In former days it was an important staging post. There are around 400 dwellings in the village. There is a large number of older villagers and a growing number of younger commuters. The church is the nub of the village community. Older villagers feel {neglected}by the Local Authorities because of the{lack of amenities}in the village, coupled with the{poor bus {service.}Residents who do not own a car have to rely on the church run "car pool"; or remain{isolated. Older villagers also{feel threatened by the{influx}of "outsiders", they see their whole way of life is{changing.
